trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies the usage of another attribute class.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The set of values combined using a bitwise OR operation to indicate which program elements are valid.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx x xxxxxxx XX xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether more than one instance of the indicated attribute can be specified for a single program element.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx x Xxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx x xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue if more than one instance is allowed to be specified; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue if the attribute can be inherited by derived classes and overriding members; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a set of values identifying which program elements that the indicated attribute can be applied to.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxx xx.$$x$$x
